Text: Re Happy New Yearwe are here permanently if the tenure gods cooperate I am teaching at Amherst College in the Department of Fine Arts Gemma is and we are expecting her sister at the end of June things are good given the upheaval moving entails We are going to be in Houston in March for the opening of the new building at the MFA its a tight trip but maybe we can have coffee or something email me a phone number where we can get in touch Nice to hear from you Mark Taylor wrote Thanks for your card and hello to the whole family I didnt know you guys were in Mass Is this a long term move Things are still pretty much the same in Houston Wed certainly look forward to seeing more of you down this way DeWitt Godfrey Assistant Professor Department of Fine Arts Amherst College Fayerweather Hall Amherst MA Tel Fax Email dagodfreyvcf

New Work at Socrates Sculpture Parkam pleased to announce a new large scale steel piece completed for the show Once Removed at Socrates Sculpture Park in Long Island City New York Almost tons of steel over pieces of Corten steel attached by nearly stainless steel bolts and measuring feet in length and feet in width this flexible structure slumps and slides across the landscape A continuation of an exploration of structures that have a role in their own making it is a simple system whose final form is only semidetermined The exhibition opens June th from pm and remains onview through the summer See the attached website for directions and hours DeWitt Godfrey Assistant Professor Department of Fine Arts Amherst College Fayerweather Hall Amherst MA Tel Fax Email Socrates Sculpture Park is a acre waterfront sculpture park located on the East River in Long Island City Queens Socrates Sculpture Park is one of the few places In New York City where largescale outdoor sculpture can be enjoyed by the public Since its opening In the fall of the Park has presented a constantly changing selection of work by the most exciting artists working today Sculptors from all regions of the United States Europe and Central America have been joined by musicians dancers painters and filmmakers to create a multimedia modern art showcase Socrates Sculpture Park is situated In Long Island City Queens where private homes factories and warehouses coexist in an unpretentious neighborhood with breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline Appropriately the park is located on the border of the largest population of Greeks outside Athens Located at Vernon Boulevard and Broadway in Long Island City Fax Directions From the Midtown Tunnel After tolls take immediate right a second right and after block a third right onto Vernon Blvd Head North to Braodway min From the Queensboro th St Bridge Upper Roadway Exit st Street North onto Broadway Continue to Vernon Blvd Lower Roadway First right continue for blocks then right Continue blocks to Vernon Blvd History and Goals of Socrates Sculpture Park Socrates Sculpture Park Is a former illegal dumpsite leased from New York Citys Department of Ports and Trade for per year The site required almost a year of work to clear and landscape before the first installation of sculpture was possible Socrates Sculpture Park is the masterwork of the Athena Foundation which was created In by the sculptor Mark di Suvero to encourage the arts to expand the culture and to create a space for the harmonious interaction of people and art After a year of clearing what was once an illegal garbage dump the Park opened its first exhibition of contemporary outdoor sculpture in Since that time Socrates continues to revitalize the economic social educational and cultural life of this community via activities that encourage creative interaction between artists their art and the community through visual arts and outreach programs The Parks existence is based on the belief that reclamation revitalization and creative expression are essential to the survival humanity and improvement of our urban environment At a ceremony on May Socrates officially became part of the NYC Dept of Parks Recreation As the newest addition to Park land in over a decade SSP is the only NYC park dedicated solely to the creation exhibition of contemporary sculpture In Socrates was designated as one of sixty three Great American Public Places testimony to the fact that the Park is an exemplary model of the built environment Although our new relationship with the City of NY guarantees our existence for years to come it does not provide support for our outreach programs for youth or community residents Community Collaborations Initiative Since Its inception the Park has operated outreach programs for youth and neighborhood residents In SSP founded the Education Department offering a variety of innovative alternative programs to some of NYC neediest youth from the local community as well as offsite in NYC public schools Many of our program target youth from high risk backgrounds These workshops further the Parks goal to redefine the role of the art institution as a purveyor of alternative education in the schools community and eventually society Through our Community Collaborations Initiative Socrates is able to design on a oneonone basis special hands on art workshops While many schools have lost funds for fine arts programs Arts Education is now recognized as an essential part of healthy development and a rounded education Copyright City of New York Queens Borough Presidents Office dagodfreyvcf
